keyMoments.title: Nami Acquires Millennium Paper
keyMoments.description: Nami discovers and purchases Millennium Paper from Rice Rice, obtaining the professional-grade materials needed to pursue her dream of creating a world map.
keyMoments.significance: This acquisition enables Nami to begin seriously working on her lifelong dream with materials that will last for generations.
keyMoments.quote: This paper is perfect for making maps! It will last a thousand years without fading!

keyMoments.title: Childhood Dream Flashback
keyMoments.description: Nami remembers her childhood in Cocoyasi Village, standing on a cliff with Bell-mère and Nojiko, where she first expressed her dream to explore the world and create maps.
keyMoments.significance: This flashback reveals the origins of Nami's cartography dream and shows Bell-mère's crucial role in encouraging her ambitions.

keyMoments.title: Beginning the World Map Project
keyMoments.description: Nami makes the decision to start creating her world map, beginning with detailed maps of Little Garden, Drum Island, and Arabasta.
keyMoments.significance: This represents Nami taking concrete action toward her dream, marking a transition from aspiration to active pursuit.
keyMoments.quote: Now I can finally start working on my real dream - to draw a map of the entire world!

keyMoments.title: Navigator's Mutiny
keyMoments.description: Frustrated by constant interruptions, Nami playfully declares a 'Navigator's Mutiny,' demanding peace and quiet to work on her maps.
keyMoments.significance: This moment shows Nami's assertiveness and her commitment to her craft, willing to stand up to her crewmates for her professional work.
keyMoments.quote: This is a Navigator's Mutiny! I need quiet to work on my maps!

keyMoments.title: Completing First Professional Maps
keyMoments.description: Despite obstacles and interruptions, Nami successfully completes detailed maps of three islands, representing her first real steps toward mapping the entire world.
keyMoments.significance: This achievement symbolizes Nami's freedom to pursue her dreams and her skill as a cartographer, honoring Bell-mère's memory.
keyMoments.quote: These maps are my first real steps toward mapping the entire world. Bell-mère, I'm finally doing it!

reveals.information: Reinforcement of Nami's childhood dream to map the entire world, first shared with Bell-mère in Cocoyasi Village
Nami's professional cartography skills are showcased as she creates detailed maps of Little Garden, Drum Island, and Arabasta

keyMoments.title: Rice Rice's Debut
keyMoments.description: Rice Rice is fished out of the water by Luffy, introducing himself as a traveling salesman from the Den Den Mushi Mail Order company.
keyMoments.significance: Rice Rice's appearance provides the catalyst for Nami obtaining the Millennium Paper needed for her cartography work.
keyMoments.quote: Nahahhahahahaha! Thank you for saving me! I'm Rice Rice from the Den Den Mushi Mail Order!

keyMoments.title: Product Demonstrations
keyMoments.description: Rice Rice demonstrates various products from his catalog including the Buru Buru Blade, Ab-Ab Slider, Golden Fish, Mero Mero Juice, and kitchen knives.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Rice Rice's character as a stereotypical pushy salesman and provides comedic moments.

keyMoments.title: Fleeing in Fear
keyMoments.description: Upon realizing he's aboard a pirate ship with Straw Hat Luffy, Rice Rice becomes terrified and flees on his Escar, abandoning his inventory.
keyMoments.significance: Provides comic relief and shows how the Straw Hats are perceived by ordinary people as dangerous pirates.

reveals.information: Works as a traveling salesman for the Den Den Mushi Mail Order company
Stereotypical pushy salesman who attempts to overcharge customers and shows minimal gratitude despite being rescued

keyMoments.title: Encouraging Nami's Curiosity
keyMoments.description: In a flashback, Bell-mère listens to young Nami's question 'What lies beyond the sea?' and encourages her curiosity about the world.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Bell-mère's supportive role in nurturing Nami's dreams and sense of wonder about the world beyond Cocoyasi Village.

keyMoments.title: Praising Nami's First Map
keyMoments.description: Bell-mère praises young Nami's first attempt at drawing a map, calling it the first step toward her dream of mapping the entire world and giving Nami confidence in her abilities.
keyMoments.significance: This crucial moment establishes the foundation of Nami's cartography skills and shows how Bell-mère's encouragement gave Nami the faith to pursue her ambitious dream.
keyMoments.quote: This is wonderful, Nami! This is the first step of your dream to map the world!

reveals.information: Further depth on Bell-mère's role in encouraging Nami's cartography dream and giving her confidence to pursue it
